content:
iv. A credit in favour of Us or the intermediary is made through an electronic medium including the internet.
b. In the event that the total premium due is not paid to the Us (or the intermediary through whom this Policy or Bond was effected) on or before the inception date or the renewal date, then the insurance shall not attach and no benefits whatsoever shall be payable by Us. Any payment received thereafter shall be of no effect whatsoever as cover has not attached.
questions: What happens if the insurance premium is not paid by the inception or renewal date?
How should a credit be made to the insurer or intermediary?
What are the consequences of late payment of the insurance premium?
Can insurance coverage be activated if the payment is made after the inception or renewal date?
What mediums can be used to make a credit payment for the insurance?
Is there any possibility of receiving benefits if the premium is paid after the due date?
What does it mean when it is stated that 'the insurance shall not attach'?
What is the effect of payments received after the insurance coverage has failed to attach?
Who should receive the total premium payment for the insurance policy or bond?
What does it imply when the text states that any late payment will be 'of no effect whatsoever'?
